abstract: VeriSign, which manages the dot-com and dot-net domain names registry, said on Tuesday that its chief executive, Stratton D. Sclavos, had resigned for undisclosed reasons. Analysts were startled by the abrupt departure. The company gave little information about the reason for Mr. Sclavos’s departure after 12 years as chief executive.
lead_paragraph: VeriSign, which manages the dot-com and dot-net domain names registry, said on Tuesday that its chief executive, Stratton D. Sclavos, had resigned for undisclosed reasons. Analysts were startled by the abrupt departure. The company gave little information about the reason for Mr. Sclavos’s departure after 12 years as chief executive.
